name: cystoscope
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a long, thin medical device that is put into the urethra (= the tube that carries urine out of the body) to examine the bladder (= the organ where urine is stored before it leaves the body): A thin flexible tube called a cystoscope is inserted through the urethra into the bladder. A cystoscope may have an additional instrument attached to perform a treatment procedure, such as a biopsy. Related word

More examplesFewer examplesThe cystoscope is pencil-thin and has a light at the tip to allow a look inside the tract.The doctor uses the cystoscope to look for abnormalities in the interior of the bladder. All stents were placed retrogradely using a flexible cystoscope.
